dublinCore.dc:title: 119 HR 2329 IH: Uzbekistan Normalized Trade Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Kelly of Mississippi (for himself and Mr. Vicente Gonzalez of Texas) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Ways and Means

form.official-title: To authorize the extension of nondiscriminatory treatment (normal trade relations treatment) to products of Uzbekistan.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Uzbekistan Normalized Trade Act.

section.header: Termination of application of title IV of the Trade Act of 1974 to products of Uzbekistan

subsection.header: Presidential determinations and extension of nondiscriminatory treatment
subsection.text: Notwithstanding any provision of title IV of the Trade Act of 1974 (19 U.S.C. 2431 et seq.), the President mayâ€”

paragraph.text: determine that such title should no longer apply to Uzbekistan; and
after making a determination under paragraph (1) with respect to Uzbekistan, proclaim the extension of nondiscriminatory treatment (normal trade relations treatment) to the products of Uzbekistan.

subsection.header: Termination of applicability of title IV
subsection.text: On and after the date on which the President extends nondiscriminatory treatment to the products of Uzbekistan pursuant to subsection (a), title IV of the Trade Act of 1974 (19 U.S.C. 2431 et seq.) shall cease to apply to Uzbekistan.

This section shall take effect on the date on which the President certifies to Congress that Uzbekistan has acceded to the Marrakesh Agreement Establishing the World Trade Organization and is a Member of the World Trade Organization.
